intro: Acrodiclidium mahuba, commonly known as the Mahuba cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a small, spiny shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features a short, thick stem covered in dense, white spines that provide protection from herbivores and excessive sunlight. Its flowers are yellowish-green and appear in clusters, blooming during the rainy season. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
